and the last one is around um reactive extensions for Uno and so one of the
common problems that we have when we're building apps is that the notion of data binding is really simple okay and you
know it's very easy for us to spin up a UI spin up a view model that's going to be data bound to the UI and expose a
bunch of properties they're going to change and reflect in the UI and we kind of think of the view model as being the state of IUI but as the complexity of
our app increases and we start to to have a bunch of services and managers and things like that that are driving
change in the background one of the problems that we often face is having to you know work out how we're going to be
publishing updates back to the UI to get it to refresh properly and so quite often um you know this is one of the
complaints about xaml is that it's not sort of mvu in terms of it's not this new model where you know updates go down
the pipe and then we get State change coming back up here we go mutable data or immutable State coming back up and so
what we're trying to do with the reactive extensions is to provide a model where you can still use data binding except your your view model now
exposes a state or a feed of states and the challenge there is normally that trying to do data binding between you
know a feed or an observable is actually quite problematic because none of the UI controls are designed to support that
and so the reactive extensions is designed to to generate a bunch of boiler like code that actually does that
glue between the two based on our view model okay and the last part is the tooling
